content.text:
# 21st Asianet Film Awards

| host =
| date = 6, 7 April 2019
| location = Kochi
| country =

| network = Asianet & Asianet Plus

The 21st Asianet Film Awards, honoring the best Malayalam films of 2018, was held on 6 and 7 April 2019 near at FACT Sports Association Ground, Kalamassery, Kochi. The show was hosted by Nyla Usha, Govind Padmasoorya and Prathibha Sai.

Special awards
{| class="wikitable" style="width:100%"
|- style="background:#BEBEBE"
! width="20%" |  Category
! width="45%" |  Winner
! width="35%" |  Work
|-
| style="text-align:center" | Lifetime Achievement Award
| Sreekumaran Thampi
| For his lifetime contribution to Malayalam film industry as a Lyricist, director and screenwriter.
|-
| style="text-align:center" | Golden Star Award
| Jayaram
| For his contribution to Malayalam film industry being as a versatile actor.
|-
| rowspan=2 style="text-align:center" | Honour Special Jury Award
| Urvashi
| For her contribution to Malayalam film industry in 2018 as an actress in the movies Ente Ummante Peru and Aravindante Athidhikal.
|-
| Joju George
| For his contribution to Malayalam film industry in 2018 as an actor in the movie Joseph.
|-
| style="text-align:center" |  Evergreen Entertainer
| Mukesh
| For being a complete actor and a public representative.
|-
| style="text-align:center" |  Performer of the year
| Tovino Thomas
| For his enchanting performance throughout all his movies in the year 2018.
|}
